BL.content: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law
BL.linkedContent: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law

MPM.content: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
MPM.linkedContent: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)

P.content: sublime as striction and counter-striction [surges up indirectly unlike pleasure of beauty]
P.linkedContent: sublime as striction and counter-striction [surges up indirectly unlike pleasure of beauty]

P.content: sublime (Erhaben), superelevation (what in Glas is called the élève), absolutely high, not measurable in height
P.linkedContent: sublime (Erhaben), superelevation (what in Glas is called the élève), absolutely high, not measurable in height

P.content: beauty & sublime: please by themselves, independent of judgment of senses & determinate judgments, pretension to universal validity on side of pleasure (not knowledge), both reflexive judgments > beautiful (finite) requires parergon, presence of limit gives form to beautiful, this bordered edging not only externally limited but called in by hollowing of lacunary quality w/in the work (ergon) > colossal/sublime excludes parergon, not ergon, usually nature, “w/out limit”
P.linkedContent: beauty & sublime: please by themselves, independent of judgment of senses & determinate judgments, pretension to universal validity on side of pleasure (not knowledge), both reflexive judgments > beautiful (finite) requires parergon, presence of limit gives form to beautiful, this bordered edging not only externally limited but called in by hollowing of lacunary quality w/in the work (ergon) > colossal/sublime excludes parergon, not ergon, usually nature, “w/out limit”

P.content: re: sublime, arrest of outpouring (épanchement) at floodgate (vanne), pressed on limit, pleasure gushes after arrest, inhibition, suspension (Hemmung), an arresting that makes flow > for a blink of an eye passage is closed, stricture absolute, then barrage, l’inondation
P.linkedContent: re: sublime, arrest of outpouring (épanchement) at floodgate (vanne), pressed on limit, pleasure gushes after arrest, inhibition, suspension (Hemmung), an arresting that makes flow > for a blink of an eye passage is closed, stricture absolute, then barrage, l’inondation

P.content: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality
P.linkedContent: “negative pleasure” of sublime, respect, admiration, is different from “positive pleasure” of beautiful, and unique from beauty’s negativity (the work of of mourning in beauty), which was already singular, a negativity w/out negativity, sans sans sans, sans of pure cut, sans fin of finality

P.content: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability
P.linkedContent: sublime does violence to our imagination, all the more sublime for that, shock, double bind (attraction, repulsion), violent incommensurability

P.content: abyss, the privileged presentation of sublime (the ocean)
P.linkedContent: abyss, the privileged presentation of sublime (the ocean)

P.content: beauty: w/out interest; sublime: counter-interest
P.linkedContent: beauty: w/out interest; sublime: counter-interest

P.content: “pleasing-oneself-in” of sublime suspends play, elevates to seriousness, nur negativ, relates to moral law, both presuppose violence done to senses, w/ sublime violence done by imagination, not reason > imagination mutilates itself, conceals itself, binds, robs itself: sacrificial violence gains by losing > organizes expropriation w/in calculation > imagination organizes theft of its own freedom, feels sacrifice/theft at same time as the Ursache to which it submits [see GOD]
P.linkedContent: “pleasing-oneself-in” of sublime suspends play, elevates to seriousness, nur negativ, relates to moral law, both presuppose violence done to senses, w/ sublime violence done by imagination, not reason > imagination mutilates itself, conceals itself, binds, robs itself: sacrificial violence gains by losing > organizes expropriation w/in calculation > imagination organizes theft of its own freedom, feels sacrifice/theft at same time as the Ursache to which it submits [see GOD]

P.content: no object of sublime, presentation of inadequation of unpresentable, principle of sublime must be in ourselves, in Reason (moral seriousness w/out play), reason of the colossal
P.linkedContent: no object of sublime, presentation of inadequation of unpresentable, principle of sublime must be in ourselves, in Reason (moral seriousness w/out play), reason of the colossal

P.content: unlike beauty, sublime must be found w/in ourselves
P.linkedContent: unlike beauty, sublime must be found w/in ourselves

P.content: though Kant’s examples of the sublime are nature, it is only found w/in ourselves, so all comments on sublime are an appendix to aesthetics of natural finality
P.linkedContent: though Kant’s examples of the sublime are nature, it is only found w/in ourselves, so all comments on sublime are an appendix to aesthetics of natural finality

P.content: Hegel reproaches Kant for starting from cise and not from w/out cise: i.e. the sublime, for Hegel, goes beyond symbol, expresses itself only by marking annihilation of expression, in sublime, content (infinity itself, the one, substance) sublates form > Kant is wrong to think subjectivity, finitude, could signify it, but Kant would respond in principle: one can only think w/out cise, the colossal, by way of figure [signified infinity vs. signifying finitude]
P.linkedContent: Hegel reproaches Kant for starting from cise and not from w/out cise: i.e. the sublime, for Hegel, goes beyond symbol, expresses itself only by marking annihilation of expression, in sublime, content (infinity itself, the one, substance) sublates form > Kant is wrong to think subjectivity, finitude, could signify it, but Kant would respond in principle: one can only think w/out cise, the colossal, by way of figure [signified infinity vs. signifying finitude]

P.content: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)
P.linkedContent: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)

P.content: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)

P.content: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s
P.linkedContent: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s

P.content: w/ sublime, everything that is compared to it is small > here, Kant throws a bridge, the bridge like the symbol throws itself [by way of reason?], btwn unpresentable and presentation > the whole world can be made small in relation to sublime magnitude
P.linkedContent: w/ sublime, everything that is compared to it is small > here, Kant throws a bridge, the bridge like the symbol throws itself [by way of reason?], btwn unpresentable and presentation > the whole world can be made small in relation to sublime magnitude

P.content: small/big (problem of sublime) measured against, w/in, living body of man > starting from it, the erection of the largest is preferred
P.linkedContent: small/big (problem of sublime) measured against, w/in, living body of man > starting from it, the erection of the largest is preferred

P.content: imagination (btwn sensibility & understanding) has 2 operations, is the cise because it has 2 cises: 1) has the cise of what it delimits 2) and cise of what it de-limits, i.e. that which is liberated in it of its limits [apprehension lets go in comprehension what it gains in apprehension]
P.linkedContent: imagination (btwn sensibility & understanding) has 2 operations, is the cise because it has 2 cises: 1) has the cise of what it delimits 2) and cise of what it de-limits, i.e. that which is liberated in it of its limits [apprehension lets go in comprehension what it gains in apprehension]

P.content: human body as topos of experience of sublime because it is a median btwn sensibility & mathematical indefinite
P.linkedContent: human body as topos of experience of sublime because it is a median btwn sensibility & mathematical indefinite

P.content: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?
P.linkedContent: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?

P.content: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime
P.linkedContent: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime

P.content: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height
P.linkedContent: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height

P.content: glas et galactique du colossos, the bridge [tree?] over the abyss which threatens to swallow everything, interval btwn dynamic/mathematical sublime, on edge of which analytic of sublime is broached (s’entame): whirlpool heaves/tears tree into la dissemence laiteuse (the question is the cipher writing on the surface of nature)
P.linkedContent: glas et galactique du colossos, the bridge [tree?] over the abyss which threatens to swallow everything, interval btwn dynamic/mathematical sublime, on edge of which analytic of sublime is broached (s’entame): whirlpool heaves/tears tree into la dissemence laiteuse (the question is the cipher writing on the surface of nature)

TB.content: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society > Benjamin interested in an original kinship, affinity (Verwandschaft), alliance btwn languages, contract of translation beyond blood ties, empirical symbioses > Derrida compares this affinity to Kant’s sublime: rendering present an affinity that’s never present in this presentation
TB.linkedContent: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society > Benjamin interested in an original kinship, affinity (Verwandschaft), alliance btwn languages, contract of translation beyond blood ties, empirical symbioses > Derrida compares this affinity to Kant’s sublime: rendering present an affinity that’s never present in this presentation

IW.content: Cohen’s discourse about nationalism a discourse on sublime, sublimity of spiritual forms hand in hand w/ mathematization of rhythm: sources of feeling, originality of German music
IW.linkedContent: Cohen’s discourse about nationalism a discourse on sublime, sublimity of spiritual forms hand in hand w/ mathematization of rhythm: sources of feeling, originality of German music

D.content: innumerable as force, blows up (or out of) all frames, & it works through it (taken into account) from the inside [Kant’s mathematical sublime?]
D.linkedContent: innumerable as force, blows up (or out of) all frames, & it works through it (taken into account) from the inside [Kant’s mathematical sublime?]

+R.content: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column
+R.linkedContent: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column

+R.content: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)
+R.linkedContent: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)

+R.content: cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]
+R.linkedContent: cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]

+R.content: Nancy: sublime occurs on edge of art
+R.linkedContent: Nancy: sublime occurs on edge of art

E.content: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure
E.linkedContent: Kant: sublime occurs due to a momentary checking (Hemmung, an arrest), and its pleasure (admiration or respect) is a negative pleasure

E.content: though sublimity works against our senses, the sacrifice (Aufopferung) of the sublime keeps a power in view, sublime can dawn in art: attains a power greater than what was sacrificed
E.linkedContent: though sublimity works against our senses, the sacrifice (Aufopferung) of the sublime keeps a power in view, sublime can dawn in art: attains a power greater than what was sacrificed

E.content: economic calculation allows sublime to be swallowed
E.linkedContent: economic calculation allows sublime to be swallowed

E.content: Derrida compares the work of mourning to the sublime, both allow negative pleasures to be reappropriated by economic calculation
E.linkedContent: Derrida compares the work of mourning to the sublime, both allow negative pleasures to be reappropriated by economic calculation

BSi.content: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy
BSi.linkedContent: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy
